component.hassio.issues.issue_system_mul: Kunne ikke omdøbe filsystemet. Tjek Supervisor-logfilerne for flere detaljer.

`{reference}` is a filesystem with the name hassos-data and is not the active data disk. This can cause ioBroker to choose the wrong data disk at system reboot.

Use the fix option to rename the filesystem to prevent this. Alternatively you can move the data disk to the drive (overwriting its contents) or remove the drive from the system.
component.hassio.issues.issue_system_reb: Kunne ikke genstarte systemet. Tjek supervisor-logfilerne for at få flere oplysninger.

Der blev ændret indstillinger, som kræver en genstart af systemet for at få virkning.

Denne rettelse vil udføre en genstart af systemet, hvilket vil gøre ioBroker og alle tilføjelser utilgængelige i en kort periode.

Par med en enhed via HomeKit-tilbehørsprotokollen

Enheden er muligvis ikke i parringstilstand og kræver muligvis et fysisk eller virtuelt knaptryk. Sørg for, at enheden er i parringstilstand, eller prøv at genstarte enheden, og fortsæt derefter med at genoptage parringen.
HomeKit-controlleren kommunikerer via det lokale netværk ved hjælp af en sikker krypteret forbindelse uden en separat HomeKit-controller eller iCloud. Vælg den enhed, du vil parre med:

component.mqtt.options.step.options.desc:
Discovery - If discovery is enabled (recommended), ioBroker will automatically discover devices and entities which publish their configuration on the MQTT broker. If discovery is disabled, all configuration must be done manually.
Discovery prefix - The prefix a configuration topic for automatic discovery must start with.
Birth message - The birth message will be sent each time ioBroker (re)connects to the MQTT broker.
Will message - The will message will be sent each time ioBroker loses its connection to the broker, both in case of a clean (e.g. ioBroker shutting down) and in case of an unclean (e.g. ioBroker crashing or losing its network connection) disconnect.

Follow the [instructions]({more_info_url}) to configure the Cloud Console:

1. Go to the [OAuth consent screen]({oauth_consent_url}) and configure
1. Go to [Credentials]({oauth_creds_url}) and click **Create Credentials**.
1. From the drop-down list select **OAuth client ID**.
1. Select **Web Application** for the Application Type.
1. Add `{redirect_url}` under *Authorized redirect URI*.

App Auth has been deprecated by Google to improve security, and you need to take action by creating new application credentials.

Open the [documentation]({more_info_url}) to follow along as the next steps will guide you through the steps you need to take to restore access to your Nest devices.
component.nest.config.step.cloud_project: Enter the Cloud Project ID below e.g. *example-project-12345*. See the [Google Cloud Console]({cloud_console_url}) or the documentation for [more info]({more_info_url}).
component.nest.config.step.create_cloud_:
The Nest integration allows you to integrate your Nest Thermostats, Cameras, and Doorbells using the Smart Device Management API. The SDM API **requires a US $5** one time setup fee. See documentation for [more info]({more_info_url}).

1. Go to the [Google Cloud Console]({cloud_console_url}).
1. If this is your first project, click **Create Project** then **New Project**.
1. Give your Cloud Project a Name and then click **Create**.
1. Save the Cloud Project ID e.g. *example-project-12345* as you will need it later
1. Go to API Library for [Smart Device Management API]({sdm_api_url}) and click **Enable**.
1. Go to API Library for [Cloud Pub/Sub API]({pubsub_api_url}) and click **Enable**.

Proceed when your cloud project is set up.
Nest: Create and configure Cloud Project
component.nest.config.step.device_projec:
Create a Nest Device Access project which **requires paying Google a US $5 fee** to set up.
1. Go to the [Device Access Console]({device_access_console_url}), and through the payment flow.
1. Click on **Create project**
1. Give your Device Access project a name and click **Next**.
1. Enter your OAuth Client ID
1. Enable events by clicking **Enable** and **Create project**.

Enter your Device Access Project ID below ([more info]({more_info_url})).
Nest: Create a Device Access Project

Update the Nest Device Access Project with your new OAuth Client ID ([more info]({more_info_url}))
1. Go to the [Device Access Console]({device_access_console_url}).
1. Click the trash icon next to *OAuth Client ID*.
1. Click the `...` overflow menu and *Add Client ID*.
1. Enter your new OAuth Client ID and click **Add**.

Your OAuth Client ID is: `{client_id}`

component.xbox_live.issues.pending_remov:
The Xbox Live integration is pending removal from ioBroker and will no longer be available as of ioBroker 2023.2.

The integration is being removed, because it is only useful for the legacy device Xbox 360 and the upstream API now requires a paid subscription. Newer consoles are supported by the Xbox integration for free.

Remove the Xbox Live YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart ioBroker to fix this issue.

Din gamle radio er blevet nulstillet.  Hvis hardwaren ikke længere er nødvendig, kan du nu frakoble den.

Du kan nu tilslutte din nye radio.
component.zha.options.step.intent_migrat:
Før du tilslutter din nye radio, skal din gamle radio nulstilles.  En automatisk sikkerhedskopi udføres.  Hvis du bruger en kombineret Z-Wave og Zigbee-adapter som HUSBZB-1, vil dette kun nulstille Zigbee-delen.

* Bemærk: Hvis du migrerer fra en **ConBee/RaspBee**, skal du sørge for, at den kører firmware '0x26720700' eller nyere! Ellers kan nogle enheder muligvis ikke styres efter migrering, før de genstartes.*
